summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, covering the shifts on August 9 and 10, 2019. The logs detail routine prison operations and, most significantly, the medical emergency and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate, registered as #76318-054, who was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) on the morning of August 10, 2019, leading to a medical emergency, CPR, and transport to a hospital.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at approximately 6:33 AM. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, EMS arrived and continued CPR, and he was transported to a local hospital via ambulance.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Dry Cell
events.description: An inmate (context suggests it was likely Jeffrey Epstein) was transferred to a special housing dry cell at 3:58 PM.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Psych Observation
events.description: An inmate (context suggests it was likely Jeffrey Epstein) was transferred to special housing for psychological observation at 7:24 PM on the evening of August 10, which is after the log of his death earlier that morning (this appears to be a log entry from the prior day, August 9, mis-labeled or out of sequence).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220, Unit 9 South) at 6:33 AM on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed by prison staff and continued by responding EMTs from EMS. Epstein was transported to a local hospital via ambulance at 7:10 AM.
The prison logs show Epstein was on 'psych observation' with an inmate companion and had been in a 'dry cell' under staff watch in the days/hours leading up to his death.
The logs document routine prison operations, counts, and system checks (fire alarms, PREA announcements, body alarms) alongside the emergency event.
The document consists of multiple daily logs from different shifts (Day Watch, Evening Watch, Morning Watch) spanning August 9-10, 2019, providing a timeline of events.
